questions.explanation: Metro Ethernet extends traditional Ethernet (LAN) technology across a metropolitan area and allows bandwidth to be increased dynamically without replacing physical infrastructure. SD-WAN is designed for large-scale and globally distributed deployments, such as IoT and mobile enterprises, and optimizes application performance with improved speed, reliability, and cloud connectivity.

In Cisco SD-WAN, the management plane (vManage) provides centralized configuration and monitoring. The orchestration plane (vBond) handles secure onboarding of devices into the overlay. The control plane (vSmart) builds and maintains the network topology and routing information. The data plane (WAN Edge) forwards traffic based on control-plane decisions.

In Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN, vManage provides the centralized GUI for configuration, monitoring, and troubleshooting. The vSmart controller operates in the control plane and uses OMP to distribute routing and policy information. WAN Edge devices operate in the data plane and are responsible for forwarding traffic, encryption, QoS, and security enforcement.
